channel.title: Java multithreading
channel.description:
I need some help with multi threading...
Ok, I have a class that implements runnable. How can I make it have a new thread when i launch it? (or call a function)
TYVM
pwnd - if you don have anything thats not gay to say then leave

item.title: Java multithreading
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

newbiehacker:

if the class doesn't extend anything you could just make it extend Thread and make it start itself when instantiated

It also depends on your preferences whether or not you want it to extend Thread or to implement Runnable.

Read full topic

item.title: Java multithreading
item.dc:creator: @RegeX RegeX
item.description:
@RegeX wrote:

Let's say, for example, RunnableImpl is the class that implements Runnable.
This class defines the void run() method of course, which is the method that will be invoked in a seperate thread.

To launch a new Thread of RunnableImpl:

RunnableImpl impl = new RunnableImpl(); // Simply declaring a new instance of RunnableImpl
Thread t = new Thread(impl); // The Thread class takes either a Thread child or a Runnable implementation
t.start(); // This will fire RunnableImpl.run() in a seperate thread.

Note that run(); will not be reinvoked, if you want it to live past the first invocation you must put a while() loop in to prevent the code exiting run()

Read full topic
